result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark D Colletti was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
*Probation review hearing May 13, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.

miscConds.notes:
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.

-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court-CHIPS Order to controll contact.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.

-Attend and successfully complete  Anger Management and continued programming.
-Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-Parenting classes.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

timeConds.notes:
-Serve 30 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 3-11-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
*5/13/2016 Honorable Michelle Havas-Order for Commitment signed.  STAY LIFTED as to 30 days.  Straight time.  Forthwith.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mark D Colletti in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 30 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Defendant Mark D Colletti in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub for Gabriella Leija.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered another probation revierw hearing.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court. Defendant Mark D Colletti not in court. Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court to address a conflict between DOC and the case manager on the CHIPS case regarding whether the defendant can have contact with the child. Court orders that there be a no-contact order in place unless authorized by the court or agent.
State is requesting clarification between DOC and CHIPS casemanager regarding contact with child.  Case set for hearing on 1-28-2016.

Defendant Mark D Colletti in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, with credit for 3 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 30 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 3-11-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete  Anger Management and continued programming.
-Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Parenting classes.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court-CHIPS Order to controll contact.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
RECEIVED & FILED: Aurora Health Services letter; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
JusticePoint Violation Report (missed office contact) received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Mark D Colletti in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Case adjourned to 12-10-2015 at 8:15 for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Defendant Mark D Colletti in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Sarah McNutt appeared for  Abbey DeSiato for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter remains on for trial on 11-18-2015.

Defendant Mark D Colletti in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for Abbey DeSiato for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is requesting modification of the No Contact Order.  Defendant has had 2 clean drug tests and the state does not have an objection to visitation with children if supervised by BMCW.  The court will allow visitation under BMCW supervision.
At request of defense matter is set for a review of NO CONTACT ORDER on 10-7-2015 at 1:15pm.  Counsel to inform ADA DeSiato.

Defendant Mark D Colletti in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requested final pre-trial and jury trial dates. Offer will remain open until the final pre-trial. Case adjourned to Branch 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Status Update.

Defendant Mark D Colletti in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers FOR GABRIELA LEIJA.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Case Worker EMILY HOFFMANN.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time.  Case remains calendared for PRETRIAL CONFERENCE on AUGUST 18, 2015 AT 08:15 AM in Branch 38.

Defendant Mark D Colletti in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DIscovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 38 on 8-18-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  All conditions of bail are continued until further order of the Court.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision to be monitored by drug testing.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JC (8/9/10).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Mark D Colletti in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant Mark D Colletti in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
